column4: my ubuntu 12.04 had crashed, so i tried to re-install the ubuntu. it has overwritten my home directory. is there any way i can restore it
any software which scans the hd
and recovers files
any such software
There are photorec and others, but don't expect too much. How important is this data to you?
it is my 3 years of work
Then if you're currently booted from said Ubuntu install, shut down now and do the rest of whatever you're going to do from a LiveCD.
And please learn from this and keep good backups in the future.
what do i do now
http://www.cgsecurity.org/wiki/PhotoRec_Step_By_Step
First, as a quick check, please run "sudo blkid" and pastebin the output.
Did you understand my last comment?
http://pastebin.ca/2247853
Do you know why you have one ext3 partition and one ext4 partition? Do you have more than one GNU/Linux distribution installed?
that is my boot partition
doesnt photorec replicate my entire /home user accounts
No, it doesn't.

You're not going to get all your data back, and you're certainly not going to get all your settings and configuration back neatly either. This is why you really need backups in the future. Boot from a LiveCD/USB and follow the guide I linked to to get back as much as you can.
i mean the filenames
the filenames appear as <some number>. <something>
WHy doesnt photorec recover the filenames
